Variables
SharpNeat.​Evaluation
namespace SharpNeat.Evaluation
IPhenomeEvaluationScheme
public interface
IPhenomeEvaluationScheme​<TPhenome>
IBlackBoxEvaluationScheme

Represents an overall phenome evaluation scheme.

Provides information related to the evaluation scheme, and a method for creating new evaluator instances.

Type Parameter
TPhenome

The phenome type to be evaluated.

Properties
IsDeterministic
bool IsDeterministic { get }

Indicates if the evaluation scheme is deterministic, i.e. will always return the same fitness score for a given genome.

An evaluation scheme that has some random/stochastic characteristics may give a different fitness score at each invocation for the same genome, such a scheme is non-deterministic.

FitnessComparer
IComparer<FitnessInfo> FitnessComparer { get }

Gets a fitness comparer for the scheme.

Typically there is a single fitness score and a higher score is considered better/fitter. However, if there are multiple fitness values assigned to a genome (e.g. where multiple measures of fitness are in use) then we need a task specific comparer to determine the relative fitness between two instances of FitnessInfo.

NullFitness
FitnessInfo NullFitness { get }

Represents the zero or null fitness for the task. I.e. e.g. for genomes that utterly fail at the task, or genomes that fail even to decode (not possible in NEAT).

EvaluatorsHaveState
bool EvaluatorsHaveState { get }

Indicates if the evaluators created by CreateEvaluator have state.

If an evaluator has no state then it is sufficient to create a single instance and to use that evaluator concurrently on multiple threads.  If an evaluator has state then concurrent use requires the creation of one evaluator instance per thread.

Functions
CreateEvaluator
IPhenomeEvaluator<TPhenome> CreateEvaluator()

Create a new evaluator object.

Returns

A new instance of IPhenomeEvaluator{T}.

TestForStopCondition
bool TestForStopCondition(
FitnessInfo fitnessInfo
)

Accepts a FitnessInfo, which is intended to be from the fittest genome in the population, and returns a boolean that indicates if the evolution algorithm can stop, i.e. because the fitness is the best that can be achieved (or good enough).

Parameter
fitnessInfo
FitnessInfo

The fitness info object to test.

Returns

Returns true if the fitness is good enough to signal the evolution algorithm to stop.
